metadata.title: CVE-2022-25763 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Improper Input Validation vulnerability in HTTP/2 request validation ofApache Traffic Server allows an attacker to create smuggle or cache poisonattacks. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server 8.0.0 to 9.1.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25763` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 9.1.3+ds-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 9.1.3+ds-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.1.3+ds-1').
